column1: The Vishera River flows through the town.

column2: the location where the town now stands served as the 4th branch of the Solovki prison camp
column3: and since 1929—as the independent management of the Vishera camps. Krasnovishersk was officially established in 1930
column4: the same year when a paper mill was built. Town status was granted to Krasnovishersk in 1942.A memorial to Varlam Shalamov was erected in Krasnovishersk in June 2007 on the site of his first labor camp.

column6: is incorporated within Krasnovishersky Municipal District as Krasnovisherskoye Urban Settlement.

column1: The town's industries include timber and woodworking
column2: as well as ferrous metallurgy. Until 2006
column3: the main employer was the Visherabumprom paper mill
column4: which went bankrupt and was closed.

column1: An Uralalmaz mine extracts high-quality diamonds near Krasnovishersk.
